briefTitle: Annual Study to Investigate Inactivated Subunit Influenza Vaccine Due to New Virus Strains for the Southern Hemisphere 2015 Season

interventionNames: Biological: Trivalent influenza subunit vaccine Influvac

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Willing and able to give informed consent and able to adhere to all protocol required study procedures.
* Men and women aged ≥ 18 and ≤ 60 years or ≥ 61 years of age at the day of study vaccination.
* Being in good health as judged by medical history, physical examination (if needed) and clinical judgment of the Investigator

Exclusion Criteria:

* Known to be allergic to eggs, chicken protein, gentamicin or any other constituent of the vaccine.
* A serious adverse reaction after a previous (influenza) vaccination.
* Presence of any significant condition that may prohibit inclusion as determined by the investigator.
* Seasonal or pandemic influenza vaccination or laboratory confirmed seasonal or pandemic influenza infection within the previous six months before study vaccination or planned vaccination during the study period.
* A history of Guillain-Barré syndrome or active neurological disease.

outcomeMeasures.title: the Serum Antihemagglutinin Antibody Titers and the Derived Parameters Defined in the Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use (CHMP) Note for Guidance on Harmonization of Requirements for Influenza Vaccines for Influenza Vaccines.
outcomeMeasures.description: Seroprotection and Seroconversion Rate for A/H1N1, A/H3N2, and B Strains 3 weeks After Vaccination in non-elderly adults and elderly adults.

outcomeMeasures.title: the Serum Antihemagglutinin Antibody Titers and the Derived Parameters Defined in the Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use (CHMP) Note for Guidance on Harmonization of Requirements for Influenza Vaccines for Influenza Vaccines.
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean fold increase in HI antibody titer 3 weeks After Vaccination in non-elderly adults and elderly adults.

outcomeMeasures.title: Safety (Unsolicited Adverse Events) and Tolerability (Reactogenicity and Overall Inconvenience) of Influvac®.
